author: R. Roth "guvno"

review: I love Google BUT this is not what I would expect from them!!!I plugged it in to my smart TV thinking that there was a possibility that it would perform better than the TV.  No such luck.  It will not work with older Android OS's (2.3 is what I tried first).  It worked with my Chrome browser but it was slow and clunky.  I have a cable internet connection that is usually running at about 30 Mbps.  When I use my laptop or tablet to stream Netflix to it, it makes multitasking online almost impossible.I cannot find any technical details about how this device receives the signal/data that it send through the HDMI output, but it seems like the data is actually steaming through the device that you are using as the remote, then back through your router to the Chromecast.  Using this causes my Cisco wireless router to have trouble keeping a good internet connection to other active devices on my wireless network.It seems that Google should have the remote be setup so that (with the exception of Chrome browser tabs) data be streamed directly to the Chromecast from the internet service (like Netflix or You Tube) instead of through the remote like it seems to do.
author: R. Kufner "Teckie Guy"
